abstract: The highly successful fund-raising round comes during a rout in China’s stock markets, showing that the company is perceived as a long-term investment.
snippet: The highly successful fund-raising round comes during a rout in China’s stock markets, showing that the company is perceived as a long-term investment.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — As companies listed in China continue to suffer fallout from the stock market collapse, the Chinese ride-sharing app Didi Kuaidi on Wednesday showed why it is good to be private.

headline.main: Didi Kuaidi, the Chinese Ride-Hailing Service, Raises $2 Billion
